Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.ui

Class AbstractWizardStep<Common,​ErrorType extends java.lang.Enum<?>,​Content>

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.ui.AbstractWizardStep<Common,​ErrorType,​Content>
All Implemented Interfaces:
WizardStep<Common,​ErrorType,​Content>
public abstract class AbstractWizardStep<Common,​ErrorType extends java.lang.Enum<?>,​Content>
extends java.lang.Object
implements WizardStep<Common,​ErrorType,​Content>

This class is a template for the wizard steps and implements it's typical functionality.

Since:
0.0.2
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
WizardStep
LastUpdate:
0.0.3

    • beforeShow

      public abstract void beforeShow​(Common content, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> temporary, ErrorProcessing<Common,​ErrorType> err) throws FlowException
      Description copied from interface: WizardStep

      Prepare wizard step before showing it in the wizard

      Specified by:
      beforeShow in interface WizardStep<Common,​ErrorType extends java.lang.Enum<?>,​Content>
      Parameters:
      content - data type for the information shared with all the WizardStep instances (usually some descriptor to fill with wizard)
      temporary - temporary map to share with all the wizard steps in the given wizard. Every wizard step can use it for any purposes
      err - error processor
      Throws:
      FlowException - when any problems on the stage were detected

    • validate

      public boolean validate​(Common content, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> temporary, ErrorProcessing<Common,​ErrorType> err) throws FlowException
      Description copied from interface: WizardStep

      Validate content of the wizard step. If your step is WizardStep.StepType.PROCESSING step, this method will be called asynchronously. You need implement all the functionality of the WizardStep.StepType.PROCESSING step in this method only. Returned value for this call is treated as jump to the next step on true and cancel wizard on false. Any exceptions thrown are treated as cancel wizard. To prevent this behavior, you can catch all exceptions inside the method and modify WizardStep.getNextStep() method to jump to different steps in the success or failure cases.

      This method is called with any wizards before either jumping to the next step or finishing wizard only. Neither cancellation, nor returning to the previous steps never calls this method.

      Specified by:
      validate in interface WizardStep<Common,​ErrorType extends java.lang.Enum<?>,​Content>
      Parameters:
      content - data type for the information shared with all the WizardStep instances (usually some descriptor to fill with wizard)
      temporary - temporary map to share with all the wizard steps in the given wizard. Every wizard step can use it for any purposes
      err - error processor
      Returns:
      true if content is valid and pass to the next step is available
      Throws:
      FlowException - when any problems on the stage were detected
